title: If I am currently 19 years old, am I a millennial or am I a centennial? - Quora

response.answer_text: You are 19 in 2018. You were born in 1999. You are not a Millennial, you are a member of Generation Z (1996 - mid 2000s), sometimes called the iGen. I haven’t seen it called the Centennials. The best information I can find for the generational cohort birth dates is on the Pew Research Center’s website. Generational cutoff points aren’t an exact science. They should be viewed primarily as tools, allowing for the kinds of analyses detailed above. But their boundaries are not arbitrary. Generations are often considered by their span, but again there is no agreed upon formula for how long that span should be. At 16 years (1981 to 1996), our working definition of Millennials will be equivalent in age span to their preceding generation, Generation X (born between 1965 and 1980). By this definition, both are shorter than the span of the Baby Boomers (19 years) – the only generation officially designated by the U.S. Census Bureau, based on the famous surge in post-WWII births in 1946 and a significant decline in birthrates after 1964.[1]  Thus, for the various birth cohorts, we have: 1928 - 1944The Silent Generation; they are the successors to the G.I. generation, 1901 - 1928, that was named by Tom Brokaw the Greatest Generation.(The Greatest Generation was my father’s (b. 1913) and my mother’s (b. 1925) generation. They fought WW II. My father was a marine Master Sergeant who fought in every major battle in the Pacific island hoping campaign. My mother was a Rosie the Riveter type who worked in an aircraft manufacturing plant stamping out wings. They returned to civilian life after the War and worked in the 1950s to make America the juggernaut it became by the 1960s.)1945 - 1964The Baby Boomers. These are the children of the Greatest and the Silent generations.(This is my generation; I am one of the early ones, being born in 1948 to two Greatest Generation parents.)1965 - 1980Generation X1981 - 1996The Millennials (Generation Y)1997 - mid 2000sGeneration Z (the iGeneration, or just iGen)“[T]here is little consensus regarding ending birth years. ”[2]You are 19 in 2018. You were born in 1999. You are not Millennial. You are a member of Generation Z, the iGen. “Most of Generation Z have used the Internet since a young age, and they are generally comfortable with technology and with interacting on social media.”[3] Footnotes[1] Defining generations: Where Millennials end and post-Millennials begin[2] Generation Z - Wikipedia[3] Generation Z - Wikipedia

At age 19, your birth year is 1998 or 1999 (if you are currently 19 and turn 20 this year, your birth year is 1998, else 1999). A birth year of 1998 or 1999 is in the disagreement fuzzy-zone between the millennial generation / Generation Y and the the Homeland generation / Net generation / Generation Z, which is rather large. If you go by Gallup or Pew Research Center, you are Net generation. If you go by Strauss and Howe, you are a millennial. Generation Name		Fuzzy-Early	Core		Fuzzy-Late Lost				---			1883-1900	---			 Greatest / G.I.		---			1901-1924	1925-1928 Silent				1925-1928	1929-1942	1943-1945 Baby Boom			1943-1945	1946-1960	1961-1964 13th / Gen X		1961-1964	1965-1979	1980-1981 Millennial / Gen Y	1980-1981	1982-1994	1995-2004 Homeland / Net		1995-2004	2005-2015	2015-2025 Alpha				2015-2025	---			--- The transition point between Millennial and Homeland has a lot of disagreement (Alpha generation looks like its going to be even worse). Millennials were born into the digital / information age but the internet came later into their childhood lives. The net generation is born into the core of the information / digital age where everything’s online from birth. They will have the internet from birth. From a time perspective, millennials were born prior to the turn of the millennium but came of age after, while the net generation are born after the turn of the millennium.
